meals.name: IS - Paleo Cauliflower Pizza with Sausage and Spinach

recipes.title: IS - Paleo Cauliflower Pizza with Sausage and Spinach

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Line two baking trays with parchment paper. In a food processor, rice the cauliflower.

Place the riced cauliflower in a pyrex dish and microwave for 2-3 minutes- then drain off extra fluid. In a mixing bowl, combine the riced cauliflower with the other ingredients- egg, coconut flour, chia seeds, herbs and spices- and mix with a spoon or until well combined.

Spread the dough onto the baking dishes and spread until about 1/2″ thick. Place the pizzas in the oven – and bake for ~30-35 minutes or until the crust is lighty browned (prepare the toppings in the meantime).
After 30-35 minutes, add the toppings to the pizzas- and continue to bake for another 7-10 minutes. Remove the pizzas from the oven and allow to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving!
Heat a medium skillet over medium heat and put 1/2 the coconut oil (as above) into the pan and allow to melt – 30 seconds or so.
Add the chicken to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes or until golden brown. Set aside.

Heat the remainder of the coconut oil in a separate pan and allow to heat for 30 seconds or so- then add the veggies- onion, bell peppers, zucchini, garlic and saute for 5-7 minutes or until the veggies start to cook down.
Add the ginger and curry paste to the veggie pan- and mix together.
Add the chicken to the veggie pan and mix together, then add coconut milk (still over medium heat)- then reduce heat to low.
Allow the curry to simmer- add the extra curry powder, stir and continue to simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Serve your curry over your favorite cauliflower rice or regular brown rice.
Enjoy!

meals.name: IS - Easy No Mayo Chicken Salad

recipes.title: IS - Easy No Mayo Chicken Salad

instructions.description: In a small to medium mixing bowl, combine ingredients- chicken, apple, celery, almonds, cherries, dill, salt and pepper. In a separate bowl, smash the avocado with a fork.
Mix the avocado smash over the chicken and ingredients- and mix together with a spoon or a fork until well mixed.
Add extra salt and pepper if you need for extra flavor, and feel free to add the lemon juice for extra flavor as well if needed as well.
Serve the chicken salad over your favorite greens or on a sandwich, and enjoy!

ingredients.preparation: sliced into slices the size of your thumb
ingredients.name: apple

meals.name: KQC: Kale, quinoa, & cashew salad with Roasted Root Vegetables

instructions.description: Wash all produce well
Remove kale leaves from stems and tear into bite-sized pieces.
Remove core from apple, peel carrots, and dice both into small pieces.
Cut avocado into cubes.
Add all dry ingredients into large bowl.
In a smaller bowl, combine dressing ingredients and mix well.
Add dressing over the salad mixture and toss well until evenly coated.
Preheat oven to 375
Chop all vegetables
In a large bowl, mix all root vegetables, extra virgin olive oil, and herbs
Salt and pepper to taste
Bake at 375 for 40 minutes.
Turn heat tp 425 and bake another 5-10 minutes until desired crispiness.
reheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In an oven-proof dish or pan place your salmon (you can use parchment under the salmon if you want!)
Drizzle olive oil (about 1-2 tsp for ~1 lb- salmon has plenty of its own oil!). rub in a dash of salt and pepper.
Slice 1 roma tomato (optional- or just the lemon) and 1 lemon and lay slices ontop of the salmon (as above).
Sprinkle with your favorite herbs and spices – here, herbs de Provence!
Bake for ~20-25 minutes and then allow to sit for about 5 minutes.  Serve and enjoy!
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper.

Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add avocado oil- allow pan to heat for 1-2 minutes.  n a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients and mix together with a fork or your hands and form about 14-16, 2″ meatballs
With remaining 1/4 cup coconut flour, roll raw meatballs in the flour before putting in the pan on the stovetop.
Lightly brown the meatballs on the stove top for 3-4 minutes then transfer meatballs to the baking sheet ready for the oven.
Place the baking tray and place the tray in the oven and allow to bake for 20 about minutes.
Remove the meatballs from the oven and serve with your favorite sauce or pasta (like carrot noodles!).
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Prepare the delicata squash as above (cut, scoop, slice) and lay the slices out on the baking sheet.
Drizzle avocado oil on top of the squash along with the dash of salt and pepper.
Place the baking sheet into the oven and allow to cook for 20 or so minutes then flip the squash and allow to cook for another 15-20 minutes or until golden brown on both sides.

ingredients.preparation: cut in half length-wise, seeds scooped out and sliced
ingredients.name: delicata squash

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Remove leaves from cauliflower but leave it whole (don’t cut!).
While the oven is pre-heating, place the cauliflower face down in a pot filled half way with water and boil for 10-12 minutes (this is to help get the inside of the cauliflower soft).
After 10-12 minutes, remove the cauliflower from the pot and place in a baking pan, then using a fork poke holes in the cauliflower (6-8 is sufficient).

Drizzle the olive oil over the cauliflower and rub in with your hands, then sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place the cauliflower into the oven and bake for 30-35 minutes or until the cauliflower is golden-brown (as pictured).
Remove the cauliflower from the oven and allow to cool before cutting. In a small bowl whisk together ingredients for optional dipping sauce.

meals.name: IS - Easy Pesto Salmon with Roasted Vegetables

recipes.title: IS - Easy Pesto Salmon with Roasted Vegetables

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Wash and prepare the potatoes then place them onto baking pan and toss with 1 Tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt; place into the oven and cook for total 25 minutes.

While the potatoes are cooking, line a baking sheet with parchment paper and prepare the asparagus. Lay the asparagus on the baking sheet and drizzle with 1 Tbsp olive oil, then add a dash of salt and pepper- set aside.

Next, wash and chop the basil, tarragon and garlic and once finely chopped add to a small mixing dish and add 1 Tbsp olive oil and juice of 1/2 lemon along with a dash of salt and pepper- whisk together then set aside.

After the potatoes have been in the oven for about 15 minutes or so, remove them from oven and toss in the pan then place back in the oven. At this time you can also place the asparagus into the oven alongside the potatoes.
Begin to prepare the salmon by placing it in a baking dish and spread the herb blend on top- spread with a spoon or fork then set aside.

Remove the potatoes from the oven after a total of 25 minutes, then toss with juice of 1/2 lemon and dash of salt, place back into the oven; place the salmon into the oven at this time too and set the timer for 10 minutes.
After 10 minutes, remove the salmon, potatoes and asparagus (they will have been in the oven for about 20-25 minutes and should be cooked).
Garnish the salmon and vegetables with a pinch salt and pepper. Serve and enjoy!
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees and line 1-2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat and add onion, saute for 2-3 minutes or slightly browned and soft.

While the chicken is cooking, remove top and seeds from each pepper and cut each into 3-4 sections. When the chicken is finished cooking, divide into each pepper boat and garnish with additional cheese or nutritional yeast.
Add chicken to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes before adding all of the herbs, spices, salt and pepper- then continue to cook until cooked through (another 5 minutes or so).
Cook for 10-15 minutes or until peppers are soft. Remove from oven and serve with your favorite side dish. Enjoy!

ingredients.name: nutritional yeast or your favorite cheese

ingredient.name: nutritional yeast or your favorite cheese

ingredients.preparation: tops removed, seeds removed and cut into 3-4 pieces
ingredients.name: red  bell peppers

instructions.description: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tsp olive oil or other oil. Add chopped onion to pan to saute- about 4 minutes or until soft- remove from heat.
In a separate bowl mix together 1 lb grass-fed ground beef, ketchup, salt, pepper, dash each of oregano and basil, then add the sauted onion, then mix together and form patties (about 4-5 in total).
In a medium skillet, heat 1 tsp olive oil oil over medium heat and allow the oil to spread over the entire pan.
Add the burgers to the pan and cook about 5 minutes per side or until cooked to desired consistency.
Serve the burgers over a bed of lettuce or with your favorite sides

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut spaghetti squash in half and remove seeds, then place face-down on a cookie sheet and place into oven (for faster cook-time, using a pyrex dish with 1/2 inch water in bottom, cook in microwave- about 12 minutes per half).

If cooking the squash in the oven, cook for 30-45 minutes or until the shell of the squash is soft; one the shell is soft, remove from oven and scrape out insides using a fork- consistency should be spaghetti-like; set aside.
While the squash is cooking, sauté onion with olive oil in a large stock pot for 1-2 minutes or until lightly browned.
Once onion browns, add meat to stock pot and cook until browned, stirring every 1 minute– total 3-4 minutes.

After 3-4 minutes, add the rest of the ingredients – tomato sauce, carrots, mushrooms, tomatoes, herbs and spices; bring to a boil then reduce heat to simmer and continue to cook for about 20 minutes.
Once the spgahetti squash is cooked and has been scooped out of its shell, serve bolognese sauce over the spaghetti squash pasta. Garnish with extra pepper and fresh basil if desired.

ingredients.name: container organic, low-sodium tomato sauce or stewed tomatoes

ingredient.name: container organic, low-sodium tomato sauce or stewed tomatoes

instructions.description: In a medium mixing bowl- mix together, banana, quinoa flour, eggs, almond milk, water, extract cinnamon and dash of salt; mix until homogenous- use an electric mixer or simply use a fork or whisk and some good old-fashioned elbow grease.
Heat a medium frying pan over medium heat for 1 minute. After 1 minute, add the cooking spray then let the pan heat for another 2-3 minutes.
Once the pan is heated, pour the batter into 3-4” pancakes on the griddle.
Cook the pancakes for 4-5 minutes, until the edges of the pancakes are cooked, then flip and continue to cook for another 2-3 minutes. Pancakes should be golden brown when cooked.
Drizzle a touch of maple syrup or honey and add fruit if desired.

recipes.title: IS - Kale Cashew and Quinoa Salad

meals.name: Easy Pesto Salmon with   & Sautéed Kale

instructions.description: Heat extra large large pan to medium-high. Make sure the pan has a lid.
Add olive oil and garlic to pan while pan is warming up.  (this is called: "letting the garlic sweat," which releases more garlic flavors!)
Wash/rinse and shake dry kale.
When garlic begins to turn from white to golden, add kale.
Add a dash of salt OR dash of low-sodium soy sauce (not both).
Stir around kale and reduce to medium-low.
Cook for 3 minutes and stir.
Cook for 5 minutes and stir.
Cook for 2 minutes, stir, and remove from heat.
Plate immediately.  Add protein and enjoy!
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Garnish salmon with pinch of salt and pepper
Begin to prepare the salmon by placing it in a baking dish and spread the herb blend on top- spread with a spoon or fork then set aside

Next, wash and chop the basil, tarragon and garlic and once finely chopped add to a small mixing dish and add 1 Tbsp olive oil and juice of 1/2 lemon along with a dash of salt and pepper- whisk together then set aside.
Cook salmon for 20-25 min

meals.name: Balsamic Marinated Chicken with Roasted Root Vegetables

instructions.description: Combine all ingredients into a plastic storage bag. Add chicken breast and turn until completely coated.Refrigerate and marinate for two hours
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken breast on parchment covered pan. Cover loosely with tin foil and bake 20 min.
Remove from oven and let stand for five minutes.
Remove tin foil. Baste with drippings and leftover marinade.  Bake additional 15-20 min until breast has cooked through.
Preheat oven to 375
Chop all vegetables
In a large bowl, mix all root vegetables, extra virgin olive oil, and herbs
Salt and pepper to taste
Bake at 375 for 40 minutes.
Turn heat tp 425 and bake another 5-10 minutes until desired crispiness.

meals.name: Lasagna Spaghetti Squash Casserole w/ Turkey

recipes.title: Lasagna Spaghetti Squash Casserole w/ Turkey

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375
Cut squash in half longways (stem-to-butt).
Place squash on cookie sheet with the cut side up.
Roast for 1 hour.
Let cool.  Then scoop out the seeds and inner strands.
Once the seeds and strands are removed, use a fork to gently scrape out the squash.  It should look like cooked spaghetti.
Place 1 cup spaghetti sauce in bottom of 8x8 backing dish.
Spread spaghetti squash evenly on top of sauce.
Mix (uncooked) turkey and ricotta together.
Add layer of turkey-ricotta mixture on top of the spaghetti squash.
Add layer of sauce, then another layer of squash, then another layer of turkey.
Top with mozzarella and sprinkle with parsley and/or basil.
Cover and bake for 15-20 minutes.
Uncover and back for 5-10 minutes until cheese is slightly brown.

recipes.title: Easy No Mayo Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Go to chicken salad that's dairy free

instructions.description: In a small to medium mixing bowl, combine ingredients- chicken, apple, celery, almonds, cherries, dill, salt and pepper.
In a separate bowl, smash the avocado with a fork.
Mix the avocado smash over the chicken and ingredients- and mix together with a spoon or a fork until well mixed.
Add extra salt and pepper if you need for extra flavor, and feel free to add the lemon juice for extra flavor as well if needed as well.
Serve the chicken salad over your favorite greens or on a sandwich, and enjoy!

meals.name: Beyond Beef Herb Cabbage Rolls with Honey Roasted Butternut Squash

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Toss the squash, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
Spread the squash evenly on a baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until the squash is soft and browned.
Top with chopped pecans.

For the Sauce: Heat olive oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add half the onions and sauce until translucent. Mix in the tomato sauce, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, one cup of chopped cabbage, brown  sugar, vinegar, one cup beef broth,bay leaf, cinnamon, garlic powder, onion powder and salt and pepper to taste.
Stir all ingredients and bring to a boil. Simmer for thirty minutes

Bring a large pan of water to boil. Remove core of the cabbage and place the entire head in the boiling water. Remove 12-16 leaves as the head soften and are flexible enough to be easily removed. Set aside
Chop the remaining cabbage
Bring two cups of beef stock to boil and add rice. Cover and simmer about 10 minutes  or when rice is beginning to soften
Place Beyond Meat crumbles in food processor and pulse 5-10 times to make finer crumbles if desired or use straight from the bag

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Ladle one cup of sauce (remove the bay leaf) into a 9 X 13 pan.  To assemble, Combine meat, rice and chopped cooked cabbage.  Put 1/2 cup of the meat mixture near the edge of each cabbage leaf near the base. Roll up toward the outer edge, folding in the sides as you go. Place each roll seam side down on top of the sauce in the pan. Repeat for all the leaves.
Pour remaining sauce over all of the stuffed cabbage rolls and bake for one hour, uncovered. Remove from oven and let rest ten minutes before serving

meals.name: Beyond Beef Chili with Roasted Root Vegetables

instructions.description: Add beefy crumbles to a medium size skillet and heat
Add all other ingredients. Stir to combine
Adjust seasonings to taste. Serve hot
Preheat oven to 375
Chop all vegetables
In a large bowl, mix all root vegetables, extra virgin olive oil, and herbs
Salt and pepper to taste
Bake at 375 for 40 minutes.
Turn heat tp 425 and bake another 5-10 minutes until desired crispiness.
